title: Amph
author: Amph
content: anyone is experiencing the same thing? there was a consensus warning initially when i swiched, now it's not there anymrore, and it's not synching either

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: My v24.0.1 node is syncing just fine, also it works right away after I upgraded it to v24. (from an older version)Please check the last few line of your debug.log file for errors that may be related to the issue.It should be in your bitcoin data directory.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Any chance you're running a firewall that blocks Bitcoin Core?

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: It seems your Bitcoin core before was previously pruned and did you just disable it recently according to this log "Block files have previously been pruned".Do you mind running bitcoin core with -reindex this can mostly solve syncing issues.And I just want to know if you change or add something related to the network under bitcoin.conf file before it might be one of the reasons why it's not syncing.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on February 22, 2023, 01:02:33 PMIt seems your Bitcoin core before was previously pruned and did you just disable it recently according to this log "Block files have previously been pruned".Do you mind running bitcoin core with -reindex this can mostly solve syncing issues.He didn't, that'll always show if the node has pruned blockchain.To see if he's enabled/disabled pruning, check for "setting" or "command-line argument" lines.Full -reindex will not work in pruned nodes, it'll have to redownload the entire blockchain to do so.Quote from: Amph on February 22, 2023, 12:07:06 PMCode:2023-02-22T12:02:49Z Setting file arg: prune = "1907"2023-02-22T12:02:49Z Setting file arg: wallet = [""]2023-02-22T12:02:49Z Command-line arg: prune="220000"The only inconsistency that I found is you have a lower prune setting in the GUI but launched Bitcoin Core with a command line option of higher prune size of 220GiB.But doing so shouldn't cause that issue.

comments.author: HCP
comments.created_time: February 22, 2023, 09:05:12 PMLast edit: November 14, 2023, 11:29:09 PM by HCP
comments.body: Quote from: Amph on February 22, 2023, 10:36:26 AManyone is experiencing the same thing? there was a consensus warning initially when i swiched, now it's not there anymrore, and it's not synching eitherWhat exactly is it "not" doing? how do you know it's not syncing? Is it sitting on the sync window during start up but the number of blocks left is not decreasing/progress % is not increasing?I just upgraded to 24.0.1 on a PC that hasn't synced for about a month... and it is quite happily downloading the new blocks.

comments.author: Amph
comments.body: ok i fixed it by redownloading the whole chain, sometimes it happen, still don't know whyQuote from: BitMaxz on February 22, 2023, 01:02:33 PMIt seems your Bitcoin core before was previously pruned and did you just disable it recently according to this log "Block files have previously been pruned".Do you mind running bitcoin core with -reindex this can mostly solve syncing issues.And I just want to know if you change or add something related to the network under bitcoin.conf file before it might be one of the reasons why it's not syncing.yeah i use prune 200k cuz i have obly 500 gb of storage, but i didn't change that, when launching the new versioni didn't know about reindex, i'll use that next time i have this issue
